div.a: Why Are Dead People Liking Stuff On Facebook?

div.div: Last month, while wasting a few moments on Facebook, my pal Brendan O’Malley was surprised to see that his old friend Alex Gomez had “liked” Discover. This was surprising not only because Alex hated mega-corporations but even more so because Alex had passed away six months earlier.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UdIF1f&via=Digg&text=Why Are Dead People Liking Stuff On Facebook?

div.a: North Korea Launches Rocket In Defiance Of Critics

div.div: Isolated and impoverished North Korea launched its second long- range rocket of 2012 on Wednesday in what it said was a bid to put a satellite into space.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UAveth&via=Digg&text=North Korea Launches Rocket In Defiance Of Critics

div.a: 22 Terrible Things That Must End In 2013

div.div: In an effort to build a more just, rational, and aesthetically pleasing future, here is a list of 22 things Gawker is banning in 2013.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/STNTSl&via=Digg&text=22 Terrible Things That Must End In 2013

div.a: What Secrets Does The 'Man Of Steel' Trailer Hold?

div.div: You've already seen the new Man of Steel trailer, probably multiple times. But have you seen it broken down into still images, so that you actually know what Zack Snyder's Superman movie might actually involve?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VRxwZR&via=Digg&text=What Secrets Does The 'Man Of Steel' Trailer Hold?

div.a: What Your Email Inbox Count Says About You

div.div: What's the number of unread emails—right now, at this moment, without changing anything—in your inbox?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VAYxui&via=Digg&text=What Your Email Inbox Count Says About You

div.a: What The Strange Symbols On Your Gadgets Mean

div.div: On the back side of most gadgets, there's a string of hieroglyphs that look like the bottom line on the eye chart from hell. Here's what each one means and why it's on there.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VRD5ay&via=Digg&text=What The Strange Symbols On Your Gadgets Mean

div.a: Two And A Half Years Of Computer Use In One Incredible Image

div.div: A map of when artist Marcin Ignac used his computer, when he didn't, and what he was seeing

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RnBLuI&via=Digg&text=Two And A Half Years Of Computer Use In One Incredible Image

div.a: The Most Outlandish Stories From The Mexican Drug War

div.div: It's been a colorful year for Mexico due to the systematic, try-anything-once eclecticism of the smugglers, and the antic game of Tom-and-Jerry escalation that they tend to play with the law.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/US7dAc&via=Digg&text=The Most Outlandish Stories From The Mexican Drug War

div.a: Then-And-Now Photos Of An Abandoned School

div.div: To “raise awareness of the social and economic challenges the city of Detroit,” website Detroiturbex explores and photographs abandoned buildings and places in and around the city.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/X7jvCz&via=Digg&text=Then-And-Now Photos Of An Abandoned School

div.div: WE WOULD GET A BEER WITH THIS GUY

div.a: The New Dress Code For China's Leaders

div.div: Forget the Mao tunics or boxy three-piece Western suits. China’s new leader Xi Jinping is promoting a new look for Chinese officials.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TTxw8o&via=Digg&text=The New Dress Code For China's Leaders

div.a: The Physics Of Rainbows And Double Rainbows

div.div: Often we think of rainbows as distinct bands of light. In actuality we are seeing every viewable wavelength of light i.e. a continuum.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/S6emhi&via=Digg&text=The Physics Of Rainbows And Double Rainbows

div.div: A Sikh Guardsman has made history by becoming the first soldier to guard Buckingham Palace without wearing the traditional bearskin.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YWKyXy&via=Digg&text=Buckingham Palace Guard Makes History

div.a: Meet The Assadosphere, The Online Defenders Of Syria's Butcher

div.div: You might think it’s hard to defend Bashar Assad, the Syrian dictator responsible for the murder of 40,000 human beings. You must be new to the internet.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/S6KkKA&via=Digg&text=Meet The Assadosphere, The Online Defenders Of Syria's Butcher

div.a: How Much Of Your Caloric Intake Comes From Alcohol?

div.div: As a nation, we like alcohol. Like, a lot. But just how much of our caloric intake is alcoholic?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SMGgvN&via=Digg&text=How Much Of Your Caloric Intake Comes From Alcohol?

div.a: Why The BuzzFeed/Oatmeal Fight Actually Matters

div.div: Major publishers go out of their way to correct even the most trivial of errors. So why don't online publishers feel its necessary to do the same?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TNMXMM&via=Digg&text=Why The BuzzFeed/Oatmeal Fight Actually Matters

div.div: With the "fiscal cliff" looming, taxpayers are wringing their hands about all sorts of things. Income taxes might rise, dividends might get walloped, lifetime gift-tax exemptions might get slashed. But when it comes to immediate impact on their wallets, maybe they should be thinking about something else entirely: The Apple tax.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/X139eG&via=Digg&text=The 'Apple Tax'

div.a: How A Russian Prepares For The End Times

div.div: When faced with the coming apocalypse, Russians prepare just a little bit differently than some others do.

div.a: Inside The Greatest Writers Room You've Never Heard Of

div.div: Twenty-five years ago, millions of Americans gathered around their sets to watch the launch of a show that would transform late-night TV. It was called The Wilton North Report. The Wilton North Re-what? Exactly.

div.div: BOLD WITH A HINT OF NUT

div.a: Portland Man Sells Human Sh*t Coffee On Craigslist

div.div: The Indonesian palm civet. Thai elephants. Peruvian coati raccoons. And now, your next door neighbor?

div.a: Scientists Grow A Fish With Legs

div.div: In an effort to understand the evolution of life on Earth from sea to land, scientists have attempted to replicate the genetic process.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VAQXjm&via=Digg&text=Scientists Grow A Fish With Legs

div.a: Five Years Of Traffic Fatalities Visualized

div.div: Every year the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration releases a massive set of data collected for each recorded vehicle crash where there was a fatality. Here's what it looks like mapped out.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UycSqG&via=Digg&text=Five Years Of Traffic Fatalities Visualized

div.a: Half Of People Shot By Police Are Mentally Ill

div.div: An investigation by the Portland Press Herald and Maine Sunday Telegram has found that a disturbingly high percentage of individuals shot by police suffer from mental health problems.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XKnGck&via=Digg&text=Half Of People Shot By Police Are Mentally Ill

div.a: Secret Email Shows FedEx May Have Been Overcharging Us For Years

div.div: FedEx has been “systematically overcharging” customers by billing businesses and government offices at higher residential rates, a company sales executive said in an internal e-mail unsealed in a lawsuit.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VPVx3p&via=Digg&text=Secret Email Shows FedEx May Have Been Overcharging Us For Years

div.div: The answer to the question you didn't even know you had.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/S5uiAH&via=Digg&text=Where Is Balloon Boy Now?

div.a: Republicans Look To Break Their Fox Addiction

div.div: As the Grand Old Party looks to convert a new generation of conservatives, some Republican strategists are urging their leaders to start carrying their message to media outlets that aren't named after a certain bushy-tailed woodland carnivore.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/X5h0QY&via=Digg&text=Republicans Look To Break Their Fox Addiction

div.a: College Students Can Now Major In Social Media

div.div: Pretty much every kid in college right now could major in social media based on their mastery of all things Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram. But some students actually will leave college with a degree in social media. A real one. With a seal.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Uf1Ibw&via=Digg&text=College Students Can Now Major In Social Media

div.div: GOOGLE HIM IF YOU DON'T KNOW HIM

div.a: Larry Page On Google And The Future Of Search

div.div: Larry Page recently sat down for just his second lengthy interview since becoming Google's CEO in April 2011.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/URmEsy&via=Digg&text=Larry Page On Google And The Future Of Search

div.div: FREE SPEECH DOES NOT INCLUDE LINKING APPARENTLY

div.a: Feds Indict Journalist Who Covered Anonymous Just For Sharing A Link

div.div: You now can get hauled into federal court in the United States for sharing a link in a chat room, apparently.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TNtsnJ&via=Digg&text=Feds Indict Journalist Who Covered Anonymous Just For Sharing A Link

div.a: Ian McKellen Has Been Living With Prostate Cancer For Years

div.div: "The Hobbit" actor Ian McKellen said in an interview published on Tuesday that he had had prostate cancer for the last six or seven years, but added that the disease was not life-threatening.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Uzogoe&via=Digg&text=Ian McKellen Has Been Living With Prostate Cancer For Years
